meanings.definition: The act of marking or signing with a signature.
meanings.sent1: She finished the important document by signeting it with her signature.
meanings.sent2: The signeting of the contract made it official.
meanings.sent3: The cat surprised everyone by signeting the painting with its paw prints.
meanings.sent4: His unique signeting of the letter made it stand out among the rest.
meanings.sent5: The artist's signeting of the canvas added a personal touch to the artwork.

meanings.definition: The act of using a signet ring to create a seal.
meanings.sent1: The king performed the signeting of the royal decree with his signet ring.
meanings.sent2: The signeting of the envelope ensured its confidentiality.
meanings.sent3: The magician amazed the audience by signeting the paper with a hidden message.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tradition of signeting documents with wax seals continues to be respected.
meanings.sent5: The signeting of the letter with the family crest added a touch of elegance.

meanings.definition: The act of authorizing or validating something with a signature.
meanings.sent1: The principal's signeting of the permission slip allowed the student to go on the field trip.
meanings.sent2: The signeting of the contract confirmed the agreement between the parties.
meanings.sent3: The robot made a mistake by signeting the wrong form with its mechanical arm.
meanings.sent4: Her quick signeting of the document saved time for everyone involved.
meanings.sent5: The judge's signeting of the verdict brought closure to the case.
